sentences.english: The aggressors could not get supplies or reinforcements through because of the guerrilla warfare.
sentences.chinese: 由于游击战的牵制，侵略者无法输送给养或援兵。

sentences.english: A correct solution of this problem is one of the prerequisites for the unhampered development of guerrilla warfare.
sentences.chinese: 这个问题的正确解决是游击战争顺利发展的条件之一。

sentences.english: Expansion of Guerrilla Warfare and Establishment of Small, Concealed Guerrilla Base Areas in Enemy-Occupied Areas.
sentences.chinese: 发展敌占区的游击战争与创造隐蔽的小块游击根据地。

sentences.english: We will wage guerrilla warfare against the Burmese army if conflict breaks out.
sentences.chinese: 如果开战，我们会针对缅甸政府军发起游击战。

sentences.english: It is just like guerrilla warfare.
The Taliban still are there, but they only carry out guerilla tactics now.
sentences.chinese: 塔利班仍然是有的，但他们只进行游击战术了。

sentences.english: Armed with a javelin and most often fighting unarmoured , their preferred tactic is to hit and run.
sentences.chinese: 泰利突骑兵装备标枪，通常轻装上阵，极擅游击战术。

sentences.english: One reason for this is because the Viet Cong were using guerrilla tactics.
sentences.chinese: 原因之一是因为越共使用游击战术。

sentences.english: The Russian revolution was imposed ruthlessly from above, the Chinese one by guerrilla war.
sentences.chinese: 俄国革命由上往下无情地强加，中国则是靠游击战。

sentences.english: It is the key problem in the strategy of guerrilla warfare.
sentences.chinese: 这是游击战争战略原则的最中心的问题。

definition: to fight as a guerilla/(fig.) to live or eat at no fixed place
to besiege and strike the relief force (idiom); strategy of surrounding a unit to entice the enemy to reinforce, then striking the new troops
to fortify defenses and raze the fields (idiom); to leave nothing for the invader/scorched earth policy
to lie in wait/to ambush/to conceal sth
to pursue and kill/to wipe out
communist attack against the Guomindang's encircle and annihilate campaign
